original_title: Sri Lanka ragging hotline receives complaints
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Higher Education said they had received 21 complaints of ragging in state universities since the establishment of a special hotline a couple of months ago.
“There have been complaints of physical, sexual and verbal harassment,” Secretary to the Minister of Higher Education, Dilshan Jayakody told EconomyNext on Tuesday (5).
“We are currently unable to differentiate the figures as to the types of harassment.”
In September, the Sri Lanka Police established a special hotline to report ragging.
The hotline also operated through WhatsApp allowing photos and videos of instances of ragging to be shared.
Minister for Higher Education Suren Raghavan said in October the ministry would start student-based supervision groups in addition to the hotline in order to prevent ragging.
Jayakody said that there have also been 4-5 false allegations in addition to the 21 complaints. (Colombo/Dec6/2023)
